dialogue: How do you like this character?
He comes to me and says: “I thought you were one of the Green Lantern Boys.” So I said: “Well, I am.” He wants me to take him around to some of the gay places here.
As a general rule, I don’t take people to the Lantern. Either you’re going there or you’re not. But something about the way he asked me -- I just couldn’t say no.
You don’t know him, do you?
Huh?
He’s always in here playing chess with that girl. What’s her name?
Mary.
Right. Mary. She seems nice.
Though I suppose if she’s his girlfriend, she’s in for a bit of a surprise.
What?
You all right, Lee?
I’m fine.
I asked if you know that boy and you still haven’t given me an answer.
Oh... Yes. I mean, no. A little.
What’s he like?
What’s he like?
Thank you, as always, for the enlightening conversation.
Are we enjoying ourselves, Bill?
You took our friend Allerton to some queer bars, huh?
Gene. Eugene Allerton.
Oh. Yes, I did.
Most boring night of my life. I took him to the Green Lantern.
All night, just:
Finally, I say to him: “Are you having a bad time, kid? Would you like to go home?” He goes: “No. This is fine.”
God help whoever’s trying to crack that nut. Oh God, you’re not making it with him, are you?
You’ve got enough problems already, don’t you think, Bill?
Suit yourself. I gotta take a leak.
So...
How was Morelia?
